author: rjhunter

comments.content:
Both "Beautiful ES" and "Splendid ES" are rip-offs of Bickham Script, which is protected by US Design Patents 407,108 and 426,570. This definitely infringes our patents.   
   
They didn't even change the em square either, so it's easy to see that the outlines seem to be stolen too (modulo conversion to TrueType), which would violate our copyright as well.   
   
I've pointed our legal and anti-piracy folks at it.   
   
T

Im glad Thomas, I love the orginial, and I was disturbed at how it could be on their "top100" and be so obviously and completely stolen. I was going to throw it to you specifically, but I figured you'd see it on the post.
Wow. Taking on Disney, Coca-cola, Pepsico and McDonalds, all at the same time? That's pretty impressive.

Urp, right, Splendid is something else. But "Beautiful ES" is definitely Bickham Script. Should have looked more carefully.   
   
T

Thomas Adobe has a far bigger problem. I'm getting e-mails about one a week from people selling Photoshop CS for $79. Adobe should have a place on their site to be able to report the emails who follow this ripoff practice. It annoys me I pay full freight for Adobe products and someone rips them off like this.

If you see such an offer and want to report it, send an email to " [piracy@adobe.com](mailto:piracy@adobe.com)" (as listed on our Web site)   
   
Thanks!
